meta.description: Event cards - shuffled deck, one revealed per era. Card backs show if extinction or not.

events.name: Great Oxygenation
events.description: Oxygen levels rise dramatically, enabling larger body sizes and more active metabolism.
events.effect: All players gain +2 alleles this era
events.science: The Cambrian oxygen spike (~540 MYA) coincided with the Cambrian Explosion. Atmospheric O2 rose to ~15%, enabling larger organisms with higher metabolic demands.

events.name: End-Ordovician Ice Age
events.description: Glaciation causes sea levels to drop dramatically. 85% of marine species go extinct.
events.science: The End-Ordovician extinction (~445 MYA) was caused by rapid glaciation as Gondwana moved over the South Pole. Sea levels dropped 50-100m, destroying shallow marine habitats.

events.name: Ozone Layer Forms
events.description: The ozone layer stabilizes, reducing UV radiation and making land habitable.
events.effect: Terrestrial tiles now available. Players with [Terrestrial] traits gain +1 allele
events.science: By the Silurian (~420 MYA), the ozone layer had formed sufficiently to block lethal UV radiation, enabling the colonization of land by plants and eventually animals.

events.name: Late Devonian Crisis
events.description: Multiple extinction pulses devastate marine life. 75% of species eliminated over 20 million years.
events.science: The Late Devonian extinction (~372 MYA) may have been caused by ocean anoxia from excessive plant growth. Reef ecosystems collapsed and never fully recovered for 100 million years.

events.name: Carboniferous Oxygen Spike
events.description: Oxygen reaches 35% - the highest ever. Giant insects and amphibians thrive.
events.effect: Players with [Insect] or [Amphibian] traits may place 2 extra markers this era
events.science: Carboniferous O2 levels (~35% vs today's 21%) enabled giant insects - dragonflies with 70cm wingspans. Insects breathe through tracheal tubes, limiting size at lower O2.

events.name: The Great Dying
events.description: End-Permian mass extinction. 96% of marine species and 70% of land species eliminated. The worst extinction ever.
events.effect: Binary extinction check - HARDEST (need 5+ on d6)
events.science: The End-Permian extinction (~252 MYA) was caused by Siberian Traps volcanism releasing CO2 and methane, causing global warming, ocean acidification, and anoxia. Recovery took 10 million years.

events.name: End-Triassic Volcanism
events.description: Central Atlantic Magmatic Province eruptions cause mass extinction. 80% of species eliminated.
events.science: The End-Triassic extinction (~201 MYA) was caused by volcanism as Pangaea began breaking apart. This cleared ecological space for dinosaurs to dominate.

events.name: Pangaea Breakup
events.description: The supercontinent fragments, creating new oceans and isolated landmasses.
events.effect: Shuffle 3 random tiles and replace them. Isolation enables new evolutionary paths
events.science: Pangaea began breaking apart ~200 MYA. Continental drift created new oceans, isolated populations, and led to evolutionary divergence (e.g., marsupials in Australia).

events.name: K-Pg Asteroid Impact
events.description: Chicxulub asteroid strikes Earth. Non-avian dinosaurs go extinct. 76% of species eliminated.
events.science: The K-Pg extinction (~66 MYA) was caused by a 10km asteroid striking the Yucatan. The impact winter blocked sunlight for years, collapsing food chains. Small, burrowing, aquatic animals survived best.

events.name: Mammalian Radiation
events.description: With dinosaurs gone, mammals diversify explosively into vacated niches.
events.effect: Players with [Mammal] traits gain +3 alleles and may evolve one trait at half cost
events.science: The Paleocene-Eocene Thermal Maximum and subsequent cooling enabled rapid mammalian diversification. Mammals evolved from shrew-sized to whale-sized in ~20 million years.

events.name: Grassland Expansion
events.description: Grasslands spread across continents, replacing forests. Grazing mammals diversify.
events.effect: Flip 2 Forest tiles to Grassland. Players on Grassland tiles gain +1 allele
events.science: Grasslands expanded dramatically in the Miocene (~15 MYA) as CO2 dropped and climates dried. This drove evolution of grazing mammals with high-crowned teeth.

events.name: Pleistocene Ice Ages
events.description: Glacial cycles cause repeated habitat contraction. Megafauna go extinct.
events.science: Pleistocene glaciations (~2.6 MYA - 11,700 years ago) caused ~40 glacial cycles. Megafauna extinction was likely caused by a combination of climate change and human hunting.
